current_company_name: Computational Social Science Lab at Penn
projects: [{"title":"FitBit","start_date":"Sep 2024","end_date":"Nov 2024","description":"A Django-based chatbot application designed to handle health-related inquiries using a language model. The chatbot interacts with patients by retrieving their medical data and providing responses based on predefined categories."},{"title":"Marvel Bot","start_date":"Jul 2024","end_date":"Oct 2024","description":"Engineered a conversational LLM app using LangChain and RAG, integrating Ollama to optimize three quantized models. Web scraped 4+ Marvel Wikipedia pages and deployed the solution on Streamlit, ensuring real-time, context-aware responses and efficient memory usage"},{"title":"Traversability Estimation","start_date":"Sep 2023","end_date":"Mar 2024","description":"Developed a terrain classification model using Semantic Segmentation and an attentionenhanced Fully Convolutional Network, achieving a 2% improvement in IoU. Enhanced off-road navigation for autonomous vehicles by optimizing path planning and terrain adaptability."},{"title":"Character Prediction","start_date":"Nov 2023","end_date":"Dec 2023"},{"title":"Retail-Management-System-DBMS","start_date":"Nov 2022","end_date":"Jan 2023","description":"Developed an Online Retail Database created using MySQL and PL/SQL."},{"title":"Topic Modelling - LDA","start_date":"May 2022","end_date":"Jun 2022","description":"Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) is an example of topic model and is used to classify text in a document to a particular topic. It builds a topic per document model and words per topic model, modeled as Dirichlet distributions."},{"title":"Prediction-of-Loan-defaulters","start_date":"Feb 2022","end_date":"Apr 2022","description":"In this project, we predict the loan defaulters by considering a data 6000 loan applicants with a range of 15 features. It is up to us to determine whether the applicant is likely to default on his/her loan, based on the attributes provided to us for each applicant.The main aim of this project is to successfully predict the defaulters, according to “default” column which has two values 'yes' and 'no' for default."},{"title":"Time-Series_Water-Supply-Prediction","start_date":"Jan 2022","end_date":"Jan 2022","description":"Used ARIMA model to predict the water supply by choosing the optimal parameters through Autocorrelation Function (ACF) and Partial Autocorrelation Function (PACF) plots."},{"title":"Linear Gaussian_Kernels and-Kernel Approximation","start_date":"Dec 2021","end_date":"Dec 2021","description":"A case study on how linear and gaussian kernels work.Besides it also includes the utility of Kernel Appproximations like Nystroem in case of large data sets."},{"title":"Hypothesis-Testing-EDA-Feature-engineering","start_date":"Sep 2021","end_date":"Oct 2021","description":"EDA, feature engineering & Hypothesis Testing on a telecom data set in Python"},{"title":"Analyzing-Product-Sentiment","start_date":"Jun 2021","end_date":"Jun 2021","description":"Analyzed the sentiments of the customers for a product on the basis of the reviews provided by them. The model created predicts a class (positive/negative sentiment) from input features (text of the reviews, user profile information, etc)"},{"title":"Time Series analyses","start_date":"Aug 2019","end_date":"Oct 2019","description":"Analyzed the Gold price data set of the past 40 years in India.Consequently, formulated an ARIMA model to predict the future prices."},{"title":"Taiwan house price prediction model","start_date":"Mar 2019","end_date":"Apr 2019","description":"Analyzed a data set from Kaggle regarding the housing prices in Taiwan and the factors contributing in the determination of the price.Figured out the factors which significantly explain the housing prices using multiple linear regression in R programming."}]
